definition: to cut in line/to jump a queue/to live on a rural community (during the Cultural Revolution)
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose

sentences.english: On only 10% of occasions were queue-jumpers physically ejected from the line.
sentences.chinese: 只有10%的场合，“插队者”被从队列中赶出来。

sentences.english: Please be careful not to bump into, push or move ahead of others in the queue. Also, the entire party must wait together.
sentences.chinese: 请不要推撞或挤拥其他来宾，也请勿超前或插队。

sentences.english: Two years ago 1 left the city and went to settle down in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 两年前离开城市到农村去插队落户。

sentences.english: The first variation was the number of intruders.
sentences.chinese: 首先是改变“插队者”的数量。

sentences.english: Maybe someone in the other line will let you jump the queue. But don't count on it.
sentences.chinese: 或许在那队的人会让你插队，但别太指望了。

sentences.english: Someone jump the queue at once, I become to go against the tide.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有什么插队，变成反潮流。

sentences.english: Little Librans have an acute sense of fairness and queue-barging is definitely not right!
sentences.chinese: 天秤座的孩子非常注重公平，插队当然是不容许的。

sentences.english: However, traffic chaos is still commonplace and queue-jumping continues.
sentences.chinese: 不过，交通混乱和插队的情况依然普遍。

sentences.english: The farm I'd been sent to work on when I was in my late teens was just a few miles away.
sentences.chinese: 我十七岁去插队劳动的村子离此不过几里路。

sentences.english: Two years ago, I left the city where i lived and settled in a countryside.
sentences.chinese: 两年前离开城市到农村去插队落户。

sentences.english: At the time Chen Qingyang was 26 years old serving as a doctor at the same place as I stayed.
sentences.chinese: 陈清扬当时二十六岁，就在我插队的地方当医生。

sentences.english: The queue-jumper did their jumping in front of them.
sentences.chinese: “插队者”会在从他们前面插入队列中。

sentences.english: Don't push in,wait in line like everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 不要插队，像别人一样排队等候。

sentences.english: How do you deal with queue-jumpers?
sentences.chinese: 看到有人插队，你会怎么办？

definition: to push into a line out of turn/to cut in line/to queue-jump
to give up one's seat for sb
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to refuse to take a passenger (of taxi)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
